nsr-entry.authors: A.Makinaga, R.Massarczyk, R.Schwengner, M.Beard, F.Donau, M.Anders, D.Bemmerer, R.Beyer, R.Hannaske, A.R.Junghans, M.Kempe, T.Kogler, M.Roder, K.Schmidt, A.Wagner
nsr-entry.title: Dipole strength of {+181}Ta for the evaluation of the {+180}Ta stellar neutron capture rate
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+181}Ta(|g,|g'),E lt 10 MeV; measured E|g, I|g, |g|g-coin, photoabsorption |s(E) using the bremsstrahlung facility |g-ELBE at the electron accelerator of Dresden-Rossendorf (HZDR) facility; deduced mean branching ratios and uncertainty range of ground-state transitions from |g-ray cascades, dipole-strength distribution. Comparison with {+181}Ta(|g,n) experimental data, and QRPA calculations.

NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+180},{+180m},{+181}Ta(n,|g),E lt 15 MeV; calculated |s(E), Maxwellian-averaged cross sections (MACS). {+181}Ta(|g,n) at T=2-5.5 GK; {+180m}Ta(n,|g) at T=0.1-1 GK; calculated stellar reaction rates. Calculations using the code TALYS with various models for the input strength function. Comparison with data in KADoNiS database.

nsr-entry.authors: E.Mendoza, for the n_TOF Collaboration
nsr-entry.title: Measurement of the {+241}Am and the {+243}Am Neutron Capture Cross Sections at the n_TOF Facility at CERN
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+241},{+243}Am(n,|g),E=epithermal; measured reaction products using BaF2 total absorption calorimeter at n_ToF. {+243}Am deduced |s from 250 eV to 7 keV. {+241}Am deduced preliminary |s from 139 to 168 eV. Analysis of {+241}Am done in resolved resonances using SAMMY code is preliminary.

nsr-entry.authors: E.Mendoza, for the n_TOF Collaboration
nsr-entry.title: Measurement and analysis of the {+243}Am neutron capture cross section at the n_TOF facility at CERN
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+243}Am(n,|g),E=0.7 eV-2.5 keV; measured E|g, I|g, multiplicities, neutron capture |s(E) using BaF{-2} absorption calorimeter at n_TOF-CERN facility. {+244}Am; deduced resolved resonances up to 400 eV, neutron widths, resonance integral. Statistical analysis of resonances. Comparison with previous experimental results and evaluated libraries.

nsr-entry.authors: S.Mosby, T.A.Bredeweg, A.Chyzh, A.Couture, R.Henderson, M.Jandel, E.Kwan, J.M.O'Donnell, J.Ullmann, C.Y.Wu

Comparison with theoretical calculations, ENDF/B-VII.1 evaluation, and with previous experimental data.

Measurements using spallation neutron source and the Accurate Neutron-Nucleus Reaction Measurement Instrument (ANNRI) at Japan Proton Accelerator Research Complex (J-PARC). Calculated Maxwellian-averaged neutron capture cross section of {+142}Nd and compared with JENDL-4.0 parameters.

nsr-entry.title: The decays of {+109,111}Pd and {+111}Ag following neutron capture by Pd

nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+94},{+96}Zr(n,|g), E=30 keV; {+90}Zr(|g,n), E not given; measured reaction products, E|g,I|g; deduced yields, Maxwellian averaged |s. Comparison with available data.

nsr-entry.authors: S.Valenta, F.Becvar, J.Kroll, M.Krticka, I.Tomandl
nsr-entry.title: Two-step |g cascades following thermal neutron capture in {+155,157}Gd
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+155},{+157}Gd(n,|g),E=thermal; measured |g|g-coin using a pair of HPGe detectors at LVR-15, Rez research reactor; deduced two-step cascades (TSCs). {+156},{+158}Gd; deduced levels, J, |p, photon strength functions as function of E|g, comparison between experimental and simulated TSC spectra using DICEBOX analysis. Evidence for the scissors-mode (SM) enhancement of M1 transitions.

nsr-entry.authors: J.B.Albert, S.J.Daugherty, T.N.Johnson, T.O'Conner, L.J.Kaufman, A.Couture, J.L.Ullmann, M.Krticka
nsr-entry.title: Measurement of neutron capture on {+136}Xe

Comparison of measured cross section with previous experimental results, and with evaluated data in ENDF-B/VII.1 and JENDL-4.0. Relevance to experiments on {+136}Xe 0|n|b|b decay and presence of {+137}Xe contaminant in such experiments.

nsr-entry.authors: J.Berzins, T.Krasta, L.Simonova, M.Balodis, V.Bondarenko, M.Jentschel, W.Urban, I.Tomandl
nsr-entry.title: Levels of {+188}Re nucleus populated in thermal neutron capture reaction

nsr-entry.authors: N.Cieplicka-Orynczak, B.Fornal, S.Leoni, D.Bazzacco, A.Blanc, G.Bocchi, S.Bottoni, G.de France, M.Jentschel, U.Koster, P.Mutti, G.Simpson, T.Soldner, B.Szpak, C.Ur, W.Urban

Comparison with shell-model calculations using OXBASH code.

NUCLEAR STRUCTURE {+210}Bi; calculated levels, J, |p, configurations, amplitudes using shell-model OXBASH code with residual interaction of Kuo and Herling as modified by Warburton and Brown. Comparison with the present experimental data, and with evaluated data in NuDat2 database.

nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+176}Lu(n,|g),E=8.5 eV-100 keV; measured E|g, I|g, delayed |g spectra using DANCE array at the LANSCE-LANL facility; deduced isomeric ratios to the 5/2-, 761.7 keV and 15/2+, 1356.9 keV nanosecond isomers in {+177}Lu. Comparison with TALYS calculations using different models for photon strength functions, level densities, and optical potentials.

nsr-entry.authors: R.B.Firestone, Zs.Revay
nsr-entry.title: Thermal neutron capture cross sections for {+16,17,18}O and {+2}H
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+2}H,{+16},{+17},{+18}O(n,|g),E=cold neutrons; measured E|g, I|g, total radiative neutron capture cross sections using PGAA facilities of the FRM II-Munich and BRR-Budapest reactors. D{-2}O targets >99% enriched in {+2}H. {+17},{+18},{+19}O; deduced levels, J, |p, |g-transition probabilities. Comparison with previous experimental and evaluated results.

nsr-entry.authors: M.Heil, R.Plag, E.Uberseder, S.Bisterzo, F.Kappeler, A.Mengoni, M.Pignatari
nsr-entry.title: Stellar neutron capture cross sections of {+41}K and {+45}Sc

Comparison with previous experimental values and evaluated libraries JEFF-3.2, JENDL-4.0 and ENDF/B-VII.1. Discussed effect of neutron poisons in s-process scenario.

nsr-entry.authors: H.I.Kim, C.Paradela, I.Sirakov, B.Becker, R.Capote, F.Gunsing, G.N.Kim, S.Kopecky, C.Lampoudis, Y.-O.Lee, R.Massarczyk, A.Moens, M.Moxon, V.G.Pronyaev, P.Schillebeeckx, R.Wynants
nsr-entry.title: Neutron capture cross section measurements for {+238}U in the resonance region at GELINA
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+238}U(n,|g),E=0.5 eV - 300 keV; measured reaction products, yields vs neutron energy at GELINA ToF facility with C6D6 detectors; deduced transmission coefficients for s- and p-waves, neutron strength, neutron widths, resonance parameters below 1200 eV using REFIT code, average capture |s,d|s, covariance matrix; calculated |s, d|s using statistical code |gDEX. Resultswere compared with other data and evaluations.

NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+69}Ni(n,|g), E lt 10 GK; calculated nuclear reaction capture rates using experimental level densities and code TALYS.

nsr-entry.authors: D.A.Matters, A.G.Lerch, A.M.Hurst, L.Szentmiklosi, J.J.Carroll, B.Detwiler, Zs.Revay, J.W.McClory, S.R.McHale, R.B.Firestone, B.W.Sleaford, M.Krticka, T.Belgya
nsr-entry.title: Investigation of {+186}Re via radiative thermal-neutron capture on {+185}Re
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+185}Re(n,|g),E=thermal and cold neutrons; measured E|g, I|g, |s(|g) using Prompt Gamma Activation Analysis (PGAA) facility at the Budapest Research Reactor. {+186}Re; deduced levels, J, |p, S(n), |G{-0}, photon strength functions, total radiative thermal-neutron capture cross section. Statistical model calculations and analysis using DICEBOX code. Comparison with previous experimental data.

nsr-entry.authors: O.Roig, M.Jandel, V.Meot, E.M.Bond, T.A.Bredeweg, A.J.Couture, R.C.Haight, A.L.Keksis, R.S.Rundberg, J.L.Ullmann, D.J.Vieira

nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+186}W(n,|g), E thermal; measured reaction products, E|g,I|g using the research reactor (ETRR-2) and an Am-Be neutron source; deduced |s, resonance integrals. Comparison with TALYS-1.6 code calculations.

nsr-entry.authors: B.Baramsai, M.Jandel, T.A.Bredeweg, E.M.Bond, A.R.Roman, G.Rusev, C.L.Walker, A.Couture, S.Mosby, J.M.O'Donnell, J.L.Ullmann, T.Kawano
nsr-entry.title: Radiative neutron capture cross section from {+236}U
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+236}U(n,|g),E=10 eV-800 keV; measured neutron time-of-flight spectrum, E|g, I|g, (n-resonance)|g-coin using the Detector for Advanced Neutron Capture Experiments (DANCE) |g-ray calorimeter at the Los Alamos Neutron Science Center; deduced multistep cascade spectra and multiplicity distribution of strong resonances, average multiplicity of resonances, capture |s(E), energies, |G{-|g}, and |G{-n} of neutron resonances for E(n)=29.8-998.1 eV. R-matrix analysis using code SAMMY. Comparison with earlier experimental data, and with ENDF/B-VII.1 and JEFF-3.2 nuclear data libraries.

nsr-entry.authors: N.Cieplicka-Orynczak, G.Bocchi, S.Leoni, B.Fornal, S.Bottoni, M.Jentschel, U.Koster, P.Mutti, T.Soldner, A.Blanc, G.De France, G.S.Simpson, A.Turler, W.Urban, C.A.Ur
nsr-entry.title: Study of {+41}Ca via Cold Neutron Capture

nsr-entry.authors: R.B.Firestone, T.Belgya, M.Krticka, F.Becvar, L.Szentmiklosi, I.Tomandl

Comparison with previous experimental data, and with statistical model calculations using Monte Carlo computer code DICEBOX.

nsr-entry.authors: J.A.Shusterman, N.D.Scielzo, K.J.Thomas, E.B.Norman, S.E.Lapi, C.S.Loveless, N.J.Peters, J.D.Robertson, D.A.Shaughnessy, A.P.Tonchev
nsr-entry.title: The surprisingly large neutron capture cross-section of {+88}Zr
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+88}Zr(n,|g), E thermal; measured reaction products, E|g,I|g; deduced |s.

nsr-entry.authors: A.Wallner, M.Bichler, L.Coquard, I.Dillmann, O.Forstner, R.Golser, M.Heil, F.Kappeler, W.Kutschera, C.Lederer-Woods, M.Martschini, A.Mengoni, S.Merchel, L.Michlmayr, A.Priller, P.Steier, M.Wiescher
nsr-entry.title: Stellar and thermal neutron capture cross section of {+9}Be
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+9}Be(n,|g),kT=thermal,5-100 keV,[neutrons from {+7}Li(p,n),E=1912,2284 keV]; measured Maxwellian averaged |s(E) (MACS) using neutron activation combined with accelerator mass spectrometry (AMS) technique; deduced {+10}Be/{+9}Be ratio in irradiated sample; calculated astrophysical reaction rates for T{-9}=0.001 to 10 for s process nucleosynthesis calculations. Activation technique at Karlsruhe Van de Graaff accelerator, and TRIGA Mark-II reactor for thermal neutrons in combination with accelerator mass spectrometry at the Vienna Environmental Research Accelerator. Comparison with previous experimental values, compiled KADoNiS database, and evaluated libraries ENDF-B/VIII.1, JEFF-3.3, JENDL-4.0, BROND-3.1, and CENDL-3.1.

nsr-entry.authors: J.R.Winkelbauer, S.M.Mosby, A.Couture, H.Y.Lee, J.L.Ullmann, T.Kawano, G.Rusev, M.Jandel, M.Krticka
nsr-entry.title: Statistical neutron capture in the limit of low nuclear level density
nsr-entry.keywords: NUCLEAR REACTIONS {+96}Zr,{+208}Pb(n,|g),E=thermal,301,3818,4133,5443,5971,9004,17779 eV; measured E|g, I|g, |g|g-coin, Spectra of |g-ray cascades using DANCE array at the LANSCE-LANL facility. {+97}Zr; deduced photon strength function (|gPSF), multiplicity distributions for resonances. Comparison with simulated |g spectra from DICEBOX calculations for the cascades from the capture state and neutron resonances, and with ENSDF/B-VII.1 evaluation. Maxwellian averaged cross section (MACS).
